      • File

        public File(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String openingAppId,
            net.minecraft.nbt.NBTTagCompound data)
        The alternate constructor for a file. This second constructor allows the specification of an application identifier. This allows the creation of files for different applications. You should know the format of the target file if you are using this constructor
        Parameters:
        name -
        openingAppId -
        data -

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the file
        Returns:
        the file name

      • rename

        public void rename(java.lang.String name)
        Renames the file with the specified name. This method is asynchronous, so the name will not be set immediately. It will ignore if the rename failed. Use rename(String,Callback) instead if you need to know it that it successfully renamed the file.
        Parameters:
        name - the new file name

      • rename

        public void rename(java.lang.String name,
                   @Nullable
                   Callback<com.mrcrayfish.device.core.io.FileSystem.Response> callback)
        Renames the file with the specified name and allows a callback to be specified. This method is asynchronous, so the name will not be set immediately. The callback is fired when the file has been renamed, however it is not necessarily successful.
        Parameters:
        name - the new file name

      • getPath

        public java.lang.String getPath()
        Gets the path of this file. The path is the set of all the folders needed to traverse in order to find the folder this file is contained within and appends the file's name at the end. This is different to getLocation() which does not append the file's name.
        Returns:
        the path of the file

      • getLocation

        public java.lang.String getLocation()
        Gets the location of this file. The location is the set of folders needed to traverse in order to find the folder this file is contained within. This is different to getPath() and does not include the file name on the end.
        Returns:
        the location of the file

      • getOpeningApp

        @Nullable
public java.lang.String getOpeningApp()
        Gets the application this file can be open with.
        Returns:
        the application identifier

      • setData

        public void setData(net.minecraft.nbt.NBTTagCompound data)
        Sets the data for the file. This method is asynchronous, so data will not be set immediately.
        Parameters:
        data -

      • setData

        public void setData(net.minecraft.nbt.NBTTagCompound data,
                    @Nullable
                    Callback<com.mrcrayfish.device.core.io.FileSystem.Response> callback)
        Sets the data for the file and allows a callback to be specified. This method is asynchronous, so data will not be set immediately. The callback is fired when the data is set, however it is not necessarily successful.
        Parameters:
        data -
        callback -

      • getData

        @Nullable
public net.minecraft.nbt.NBTTagCompound getData()
        Gets the data of this file. The data you receive is a copied version. If you want to update it, use setData(NBTTagCompound, Callback) to do so.
        Returns:
        the file's data

      • getParent

        @Nullable
public Folder getParent()
        Gets the Folder this file is contained in.
        Returns:
        the parent of this file

        Gets the drive this file belongs to.
        Returns:
        the drive this file is contained in

        public boolean isProtected()
        Gets the protected flag of this file.
        Returns:

      • isFolder

        public boolean isFolder()
        Gets whether this file is actually folder
        Returns:
        is this file is a folder

      • isForApplication

        public boolean isForApplication(Application app)
        Determines if this file is for the specified application. This helps identify files that are designed for the specified application. Useful in filtering out files in a list.
        Parameters:
        app - the application to test against
        Returns:
        if this file is for the application

      • delete

        public void delete()
        Deletes this file from the folder its contained in. This method does not specify a callback, so any errors occurred will not be reported.

      • delete

        public void delete(@Nullable
                   Callback<com.mrcrayfish.device.core.io.FileSystem.Response> callback)
        Deletes this file from the folder its contained in. This method allows the specification of a callback and will tell if deleted successfully or not.
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback

        public void copyTo(Folder destination,

                   @Nullable

      • toTag

        public net.minecraft.nbt.NBTTagCompound toTag()
        Converts this file into a tag compound. Due to how the file system works, this tag does not include the name of the file and will have to be set manually for any storage.
        Returns:
        the file tag

      • fromTag

        public static File fromTag(java.lang.String name,
                           net.minecraft.nbt.NBTTagCompound tag)
        Converts a tag compound to a file instance.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file
        tag - the tag compound from toTag()
        Returns:
        a file instance

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • copy

        public File copy()
        Returns a copy of this file. The copied file is considered invalid and changes to it can not be made until it is added into the file system.
        Returns:
        copy of this file

      • copy

        public File copy(java.lang.String newName)
        Returns a copy of this file with a different name. The copied file is considered invalid and changes to it can not be made until it is added into the file system.
        Parameters:
        newName - the new name for the file
        Returns:
        copy of this file
